description:
This gorgeous circa-1935-built 4 bedroom 3 bathroom single-level home will keep your loved ones very happy indeed, through its multiple living options and the generous 671sqm (approx.) block it so comfortably sits on.

Soaring high ceilings, solid wooden floorboards, decorative ceiling roses and cornices and tall feature skirting boards grace the interior of this enchanting abode and help preserve its original character of yesteryear.

Off the entry portico, double front doors reveal a splendid foyer that separates a formal lounge room / 5th bedroom - also with double privacy doors - from a spacious master-bedroom suite with a walk-in wardrobe and a double-door ensuite bathroom. The ensuite has its own bathtub, showerhead, vanity and separate toilet, for good measure.

This front part of the house also comprises of a powder room, a main family bathroom with a shower and vanity and a separate second bedroom.

A huge open-plan living, dining and kitchen area doubles as the central hub of the home with its feature fireplace, storage cupboard, double-door access out to a paved side courtyard and separate double doors that seamlessly flow out to a fabulous rear entertaining alfresco.

Back inside, the sleek and stylish kitchen boasts ample storage space, Bosch oven and microwave, dishwasher, SMEG Hob and Qasair rangehood. The adjacent third bedroom doubles as a study, if you need it to be one.

Also next to the kitchen is a well-appointed laundry with even more storage, plus access into a bonus third bathroom - toilet, shower, vanity and all. The fourth bedroom only inches away is destined to take full advantage of the position of the wet area.

In terms of parking, a tandem two-vehicle carport can be accessed from Nanson Street. At the rear, a generous single lock-up garage with a storage area and a remote-controlled roller door is accessible via Clohessy Lane at the rear.

The property is nestled within the sought-after Wembley Primary School and Shenton College catchment zones.

Walk to Wembley Primary School itself, as well as the local IGA supermarket, bus stops, sprawling parks and numerous cafes and restaurants along Cambridge Street, whilst indulging in a very close proximity to the picturesque Herdsman Lake, sporting and medical facilities, the freeway, city, beautiful Lake Monger, Wembley Golf Course, Bold Park, glorious beaches and so much more.

Impressive is an understatement!

Internal Features

- High ceilings
- Wooden flooring
- Huge family/dining/kitchen area
- Central stone island bench top, in the kitchen
- Double kitchen sinks
- Water-filter tap
- Bosch integrated ovens with microwave function
- SMEG gas cooktop
- Qasair rangehood
- Stainless-steel dishwasher
- Large bedroom sizes
- Master-ensuite bathroom
- Ducted and split-system air-conditioning
- Monitored alarm system
- Crimsafe security screens to doors
- Cabled Cat 5e to family room, office and back room

External Features

- Alfresco entertaining
- Paved side courtyard
- Entry portico
- Built in key lock safe
- Tandem two-car front carport
- Large single garage, off the private rear laneway
- Large backyard, with lush green lawns
- 3KW solar panels and system
- Gas point and multiple external power points to garden
-

Location Features

- Minutes away from parks and sporting facilities
- Short walk to cafes, food, bus stops, Herdsman Lake and Wembley Primary School
- Close to shopping and public transport, as well as the freeway
- Shenton College catchment zone
- Perfectly positioned between the city and coast

Council Rates: $2553 p/a approx
Water Rates: $1850 p/a approx
